An automated grading system for R programming assignments with a modern
modular C++ backend. Features include parallel test execution, advanced
error handling, custom feedback, AES-based encryption for test case
protection, high-performance object comparison, comprehensive input
validation, data file support (CSV, Excel, RDS, RData, TXT), and private
repository authentication with GitHub tokens. Securely fetches test
cases and data files from remote repositories and provides detailed
feedback to help students learn.

# Package index

## Main Functions

Primary functions for students to test their work

- [`autograder()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/autograder.md)
  : Run autograder by function name
- [`list_problems()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/list_problems.md)
  : List available problems/functions to test
- [`preview_tests()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/preview_tests.md)
  : Preview test cases without running them

## Data Loading

Functions for loading external data files in test cases

- [`fetch_data()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/fetch_data.md)
  : Fetch a data file from the repository
- [`prefetch_data_files()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/prefetch_data_files.md)
  : Prefetch and cache data files for test cases
- [`inject_data_into_inputs()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/inject_data_into_inputs.md)
  : Inject data into test case inputs

## Performance Analysis

Compare your implementation against the reference

- [`compare_performance()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/compare_performance.md)
  : Compare Performance of Student vs Instructor Implementation
- [`print(`*`<performance_comparison>`*`)`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/print.performance_comparison.md)
  : Print Performance Comparison Results
- [`plot(`*`<performance_comparison>`*`)`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/plot.performance_comparison.md)
  : Plot Performance Comparison Results

## Encryption Utilities

Functions for encrypting test cases and sensitive data

- [`encrypt_text()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/encrypt_text.md)
  : Encrypt text
- [`decrypt_text()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/decrypt_text.md)
  : Decrypt text
- [`generate_key()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/generate_key.md)
  : Generate encryption key
- [`derive_key()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/derive_key.md)
  : Derive key from factors

## Internal Functions

Internal functions used by the package. These are not intended for
direct use but are documented for completeness.

- [`autograder()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/autograder.md)
  : Run autograder by function name
- [`compare_performance()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/compare_performance.md)
  : Compare Performance of Student vs Instructor Implementation
- [`decrypt_text()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/decrypt_text.md)
  : Decrypt text
- [`derive_key()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/derive_key.md)
  : Derive key from factors
- [`encrypt_text()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/encrypt_text.md)
  : Encrypt text
- [`generate_key()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/generate_key.md)
  : Generate encryption key
- [`list_problems()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/list_problems.md)
  : List available problems/functions to test
- [`plot(`*`<performance_comparison>`*`)`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/plot.performance_comparison.md)
  : Plot Performance Comparison Results
- [`preview_tests()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/preview_tests.md)
  : Preview test cases without running them
- [`print(`*`<performance_comparison>`*`)`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/print.performance_comparison.md)
  : Print Performance Comparison Results
- [`fetch_instructor_code()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/fetch_instructor_code.md)
  : Securely fetch and load instructor code from repository
- [`extract_instructor_function()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/extract_instructor_function.md)
  : Extract instructor function from loaded environment
- [`extract_test_cases()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/extract_test_cases.md)
  : Extract and validate test cases from environment
- [`validate_test_cases()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/validate_test_cases.md)
  : Validate and normalize test case structure
- [`provide_feedback()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/provide_feedback.md)
  : Analyze differences and generate helpful feedback
- [`print_feedback()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/print_feedback.md)
  : Display feedback messages in formatted style
- [`format_output()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/format_output.md)
  : Intelligent output formatting with smart truncation
- [`run_tests_parallel()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/run_tests_parallel.md)
  : Run tests in parallel using multiple CPU cores
- [`run_tests_sequential()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/run_tests_sequential.md)
  : Run tests sequentially (one after another)
- [`network_error()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/network_error.md)
  : Custom error for network-related issues
- [`function_not_found_error()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/function_not_found_error.md)
  : Custom error for missing functions
- [`test_execution_error()`](https://kingssibal.github.io/R-Function-checker/reference/test_execution_error.md)
  : Custom error for test execution failures
